intro: Senecio schultesii, commonly known as Schultes' groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small yellow flowers that are surrounded by pale green or white ray florets. Senecio schultesii is generally drought-tolerant and has a low-growing, spreading habit.
